name: List
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List
description: Cluster::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: failed_locations
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#failed_locations
methods.description: Locations from which Cluster information could not be retrieved, due to an outage or some other transient condition. Clusters from these locations may be missing from clusters, or may only have partial information returned.

methods.name: failed_locations=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#failed_locations=
methods.description: Locations from which Cluster information could not be retrieved, due to an outage or some other transient condition. Clusters from these locations may be missing from clusters, or may only have partial information returned.

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of instances.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

clusters = bigtable.clusters("instance-id")
if clusters.next?
  next_clusters = clusters.next
end

require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

clusters = bigtable.clusters("instance-id")
if instances.next?
  next_clusters = clusters.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves remaining results by repeatedly invoking #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each result, which is passed as the argument to the block.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method will make repeated API calls until all remaining results are retrieved. (Unlike #each, for example, which merely iterates over the results returned by a single API call.) Use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each cluster by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

bigtable.clusters("instance-id").all do |cluster|
  puts cluster.cluster_id
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

all_cluster_ids = bigtable.clusters("instance-id").all.map do |cluster|
  puts cluster.instance_id
end

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each cluster.
